net.tomp2p.replication

Class AutoReplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tomp2p.replication.AutoReplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PeerMapChangeListener, ReplicationFactor

    public class AutoReplication
extends Object
implements PeerMapChangeListener, ReplicationFactor
    AutomaticReplication class observes the local network conditions and predicts the next departure count based on previous and current peer churn behaviors. This predicted value and given reliability are used to calculate the replication factor
    Author:
    Maxat Pernebayev, Thomas Bocek

      • replicationFactor

        public static int replicationFactor(int m,
                                    int n,
                                    double r,
                                    int minReplicationFactor,
                                    int maxReplicationFactor)
        Calculate the replication factor given the reliability within a churn interval and the (predicted) number of peers that left the system.
        Parameters:
        m - (predicted) number of peers that left the system
        n - number of all peers
        r - reliability
        minReplicationFactor - the minimal replication factor, not considering the reliability
        maxReplicationFactor - the maximal replication factor, not considering the reliability
        Returns:
        the replication factor for the desired reliability rate

        Returns:

      • replicationFactor2

        public static int replicationFactor2(int m,
                                     int n,
                                     double r,
                                     int minReplicationFactor,
                                     int maxReplicationFactor)
        Calculate the replication factor given the reliability within a churn interval and the (predicted) number of peers that left the system. Faster than replicationFactor as we only use one for loop.
        Parameters:
        m - (predicted) number of peers that left the system
        n - number of all peers
        r - reliability
        minReplicationFactor - the minimal replication factor, not considering the reliability
        maxReplicationFactor - the maximal replication factor, not considering the reliability
        Returns:
        the replication factor for the desired reliability rate

      • bestSmoothingFactor

        public static double bestSmoothingFactor(ArrayList<Integer> x,
                                         ArrayList<Double> y)
        The interval length which results in maximum value of R squared is considered to be the best solution for the smoothing factor.
        Parameters:
        x - The array of independent values, i.e. observations
        y - The array of dependent values, i.e. averages
        Returns:
        Smoothing factor alpha, which is based on the interval length which results in maximum value of R squared.

      • linearRegression

        public static double linearRegression(ArrayList<Integer> x,
                                      ArrayList<Double> y,
                                      int n)
        LinearRegression, adapted from: http://introcs.cs.princeton.edu/java/97data/LinearRegression.java.html
        Parameters:
        x - The array of independent values, i.e. observations
        y - The array of dependent values, i.e. averages
        interval - How much values should be considered
        Returns:
        R squared - defines how much percent of dependent values can be explained by independent values. The closer R squared is to 1, the better relationship between dependent and independent values.

      • ema

        public static double ema(ArrayList<Integer> observations,
                         ArrayList<Double> emas)
        Exponential Moving Average with Dynamic Smoothing Factor
        Parameters:
        observations - Array that contains peer departures numbers.
        emas - Array that contains values of exponential moving averages
        interval - The length of interval that is used to calculate smoothing factor
        Returns:
        The exponential moving average for given observations of peer departures.

      • standardDeviation

        public static double standardDeviation(ArrayList<Integer> range,
                                       double average)
        Calculation of sample standard deviation for a set of values. Inspired by: http://introcs.cs.princeton.edu/java/stdlib/StdStats.java.html
        Parameters:
        range - A set of values
        currentAverage - Average value for the set
        Returns:
        The standard deviation

      • predictedValue

        public static int predictedValue(ArrayList<Integer> observations,
                                 double currentAverage)
        Exponential Moving Average with Dynamic Smoothing Factor plus Deviation
        Parameters:
        observations - Array that contains recent peer departures numbers.
        currentAverage - Current exponential moving average
        interval - The length of interval that is used to calculate deviation
        Returns:
        The exponential moving average plus deviation for a given observation of peer departures. This value is regarded as a prediction value for the next second.
